trans-unit.source: Provides a base class that exposes an element to UI Automation.

When [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] queries the root of a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] application about an element, the root returns the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] peer for that element.
trans-unit.target: Lorsque [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] interroge la racine d’un [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] la racine de l’application sur un élément, retourne le [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] homologue de cet élément.

trans-unit.source: The peer also responds to [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] queries about its corresponding element.
trans-unit.target: L’homologue répond également aux [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] requêtes sur son élément correspondant.

trans-unit.source: Provides initialization for base class values when they are called by the constructor of a derived class.

Gets or sets an <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" /> that is reported to the automation client as a source for all the events that come from this <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" />.
The <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" /> that is the source of events.
trans-unit.target: Le <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" /> qui est la source des événements.

trans-unit.source: Gets the accelerator key combinations for the element that is associated with the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] peer.
The accelerator key.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAcceleratorKey" />.
The accelerator key.
If an application responds to keyboard events to provide shortcut key behavior, it should return a string that contains the keyboard shortcut combination.
trans-unit.target: Si une application répond à des événements de clavier pour fournir des touches de raccourci, elle doit retourner une chaîne qui contient le raccourci clavier.

trans-unit.source: For example, for an element that can copy text to the clipboard, this attached property might be set to the value "CTRL+C".
trans-unit.target: Par exemple, un élément qui peut copier du texte dans le Presse-papiers, cette propriété jointe peut être définie à la valeur « CTRL + C ».

trans-unit.source: Gets the access key for the element that is associated with the automation peer.
The string that contains the access key.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAccessKey" />.
The string that contains the access key.

An access key (sometimes referred to as a keyboard shortcut or mnemonic) is a character in the text of a menu, menu item, or label of a control such as a button that invokes the associated menu function.
trans-unit.target: Une clé d’accès (parfois appelée raccourci clavier ou mnémonique) est un caractère dans le texte d’un menu, un élément de menu ou une étiquette d’un contrôle tel qu’un bouton qui appelle la fonction de menu associé.

trans-unit.source: For example, to provide a shortcut way to open the `File` menu (for which the access key is typically F), an element might have this attached property set to "ALT+F".
trans-unit.target: Par exemple, pour fournir un moyen rapide d’ouvrir le `File` menu (pour lequel la clé d’accès est généralement F), un élément peut avoir cette propriété jointe définie sur « ALT + F ».

trans-unit.source: Gets the control type for the element that is associated with the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] peer.
The control type.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationControlType" />.
The control type.
Gets the <see cref="P:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId" /> of the element that is associated with the automation peer.
The identifier.
The value of the automation identifier is the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId%2A> property.
trans-unit.target: La valeur de l’identificateur automation est la <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId%2A> propriété.

trans-unit.source: If that property is not set, the value is the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Name%2A> property.
trans-unit.target: Si cette propriété n’est pas définie, la valeur est le <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Name%2A> propriété.

trans-unit.source: When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationId" />.
The string that contains the identifier.
The value of the automation identifier is the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId%2A> property.
trans-unit.target: La valeur de l’identificateur automation est la <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId%2A> propriété.

trans-unit.source: If that property is not set, the value is the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Name%2A> property.
trans-unit.target: Si cette propriété n’est pas définie, la valeur est le <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Name%2A> propriété.

trans-unit.source: Gets the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Rect" /> object that represents the screen coordinates of the element that is associated with the automation peer.
The bounding rectangle.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetBoundingRectangle" />.
The bounding rectangle.

Gets the collection of <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetChildren" /> elements that are represented in the UI Automation tree as immediate child elements of the automation peer.
The collection of child elements.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetChildren" />.
The collection of child elements.

Gets a name that is used with <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationControlType" />, to differentiate the control that is represented by this <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" />.
The class name.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClassName" />.
The class name.
Gets a <see cref="T:System.Windows.Point" /> on the element that is associated with the automation peer that responds to a mouse click.
A point in the clickable area of the element.

For example, if the element represents a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button>, a clickable point is any point in the visible client area of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> that issues the command that the button represents when it is clicked by the mouse.
trans-unit.target: Par exemple, si l’élément représente un <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button>, un point interactif est n’importe quel point dans la zone cliente visible de le <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> qui émet la commande représentant le bouton de clic de souris.

trans-unit.source: When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClickablePoint" />.
A point within the clickable area of the element.
Gets text that describes the functionality of the control that is associated with the automation peer.
The help text.
The returned string typically provides the same text that is provided by the tooltip for the control.
trans-unit.target: La chaîne retournée fournit généralement le même texte fourni par l’info-bulle pour le contrôle.

trans-unit.source: When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetHelpText" />.
The help text.

Tells [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] where in the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree to place the <see langword="hwnd" /> being hosted by a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] element.
This method returns the hosted <see langword="hwnd" /> to [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] for controls that host <see langword="hwnd" /> objects.
This method returns the hosted `hwnd` to [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] for controls that host `hwnd` objects.
trans-unit.target: Cette méthode retourne le `hwnd` hébergé à [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] pour les contrôles qui hébergent des objets `hwnd`.

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> that is associated with an element that immediately hosts an `hwnd` must override this method.
trans-unit.target: Le <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> qui est associé à un élément qui héberge immédiatement un `hwnd` doit remplacer cette méthode.

trans-unit.source: If this method is not overridden, [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] places the `hwnd` as a child element of the <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> that hosts the whole application.
trans-unit.target: Si cette méthode n’est pas substituée, [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] place le `hwnd` comme un élément enfant de le <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> qui héberge l’application entière.

trans-unit.source: Typically, you want to override this default behavior and set [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] to position the hosted `hwnd` parallel to the place where it is located in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] logical tree.
trans-unit.target: En règle générale, vous souhaitez remplacer ce comportement par défaut et définir [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] pour positionner hébergé `hwnd` parallèle à l’endroit où il se trouve dans le [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] arborescence logique.

trans-unit.source: Except in hosting scenarios, do not allow <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> types to override this method.
trans-unit.target: Sauf dans les scénarios d’hébergement, n’autorisez pas <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> types à substituer cette méthode.

trans-unit.source: In addition to overriding this method, the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> types that are associated with an element that immediately hosts an `hwnd` must return the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> that is cast to <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple> in response to WM_GETOBJECT coming to the hosted `hwnd`.
trans-unit.target: En plus de la substitution de cette méthode, le <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> les types qui sont associés à un élément qui héberge immédiatement un `hwnd` doit retourner le <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> qui est effectué en <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple> en réponse à WM_GETOBJECT provenant du hébergé`hwnd`.

trans-unit.source: To get a pointer to <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple>, call <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.AutomationInteropProvider.HostProviderFromHandle%2A>.
trans-unit.target: Pour obtenir un pointeur vers <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple>, appelez <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.AutomationInteropProvider.HostProviderFromHandle%2A>.

trans-unit.source: Gets text that conveys the visual status of the element that is associated with this automation peer.
The status.
For example, the status of a messenger contact might be "Busy" or "Online".
trans-unit.target: Par exemple, l’état d’un contact de messagerie peut être « Occupé » ou « Online ».

trans-unit.source: When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemStatus" />.
The status.
Gets a string that describes what kind of item an object represents.
The kind of item.
Examples of the returned string are "Mail Message", "Contact", and "Document".
trans-unit.target: « Message électronique », « Contact » et « Document » sont des exemples de la chaîne retournée.

trans-unit.source: When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemType" />.
The kind of item.
Gets the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" /> for the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Controls.Label" /> that is targeted to the element.
The <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.LabelAutomationPeer" /> for the element that is targeted by the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Controls.Label" />.

For example, if the element is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> control, the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLabeledBy%2A> method gets the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label> that is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
trans-unit.target: Par exemple, si l’élément est un <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> (contrôle), le <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLabeledBy%2A> méthode obtient le <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> pour le <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label> qui est associé le <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.

trans-unit.source: In the following image, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label> "Themes" is targeted to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>; therefore the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.AccessText.AccessKey%2A> for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label> also targets the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
trans-unit.target: Dans l’image suivante, le <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label> « Thèmes » sont destinés à la <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>; par conséquent la <xref:System.Windows.Controls.AccessText.AccessKey%2A> pour le <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label> cible également la <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.

trans-unit.source: When the user presses **ALT**+**T**, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> gets focus instead of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label>.
trans-unit.target: Lorsque l’utilisateur appuie sur **ALT**+**T**, le <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> Obtient le focus à la place de la <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label>.

trans-unit.source: ![Display properties shows labeled by usage](~/add/media/labeledby.JPG "Display properties shows labeled by usage")
trans-unit.target: ![Propriétés d’affichage montrent étiquetage par utilisation](~/add/media/labeledby.JPG "propriétés d’affichage montrent étiquetage par utilisation")

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLabeledBy%2A> method for <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ComboBoxAutomationPeer> returns the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.LabelAutomationPeer> for the corresponding <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label>.
trans-unit.target: Le <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLabeledBy%2A> méthode pour <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ComboBoxAutomationPeer> retourne le <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.LabelAutomationPeer> correspondant <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label>.

trans-unit.source: This enables an automation client to get the text string that describes the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
trans-unit.target: Cela permet à un client automation obtenir la chaîne de texte qui décrit le <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.

trans-unit.source: When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLabeledBy" />.
The <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.LabelAutomationPeer" /> for the element that is targeted by the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Controls.Label" />.
Gets the notification characteristics of a live region that is associated with this automation peer.
The notification characteristics.
This method calls the derived implementation of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLiveSettingCore>.
trans-unit.target: Cette méthode appelle l’implémentation dérivée de <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLiveSettingCore>.

trans-unit.source: When overridden in a derived class, returns the notification characteristics of a live region.
Called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLiveSetting" /> method.
The notification characteristics of a live region.
Gets a human-readable localized string that represents the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationControlType" /> value for the control that is associated with this automation peer.
The type of the control.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLocalizedControlType" />.
The type of the control.
Gets text that describes the element that is associated with this automation peer.
The name.
This method calls the derived implementation of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetNameCore%2A>.
trans-unit.target: Cette méthode appelle l’implémentation dérivée de <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetNameCore%2A>.

trans-unit.source: When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetName" />.
The string that contains the label.
You can think of this value as a string that users use to explain the control they are referring to.
trans-unit.target: Vous pouvez considérer cette valeur sous forme de chaîne qui utilisent des utilisateurs pour expliquer le contrôle à qu'auquel ils font référence.

trans-unit.source: This property is used by tools such as Narrator to tell the user what the control is.
trans-unit.target: Cette propriété est utilisée par des outils tels que le Narrateur pour indiquer que le contrôle est à l’utilisateur.

trans-unit.source: For example, a button with a string "OK" should return "OK".
trans-unit.target: Par exemple, un bouton avec une chaîne « OK » doit retourner « OK ».

trans-unit.source: A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> control that lets users select a color might return "Colors".
trans-unit.target: A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> contrôle qui permet aux utilisateurs de sélectionner une couleur peut retourner « Couleurs ».

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you have assigned a name to all controls in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gui](~/includes/tlasharptla-gui-md.md)] so that accessibility tools such as screen readers can refer to each control in a localized manner.
trans-unit.target: Assurez-vous que vous avez attribué un nom à tous les contrôles dans le [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gui](~/includes/tlasharptla-gui-md.md)] afin que les outils d’accessibilité tels que les lecteurs d’écran peuvent faire référence à chaque contrôle de manière localisée.

trans-unit.source: Gets a value that indicates the explicit control orientation, if any.
The orientation of the control.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetOrientation" />.
The orientation of the control.
Gets the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" /> that is the parent of this <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" />.
The parent automation peer.
A value from the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface" /> enumeration.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the control pattern that is associated with the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface" />.
The object that implements the pattern interface; <see langword="null" /> if this peer does not support this interface.
The position on the screen to get the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" /> from.
Gets an <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" /> from the specified point.
The <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" /> at the specified point.
The position on the screen to get the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" /> from.
When overridden in a derived class, is called from <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetPeerFromPoint(System.Windows.Point)" />.
The <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" /> at the specified point.
Gets a value that indicates whether the element that is associated with this automation peer currently has keyboard focus.
<see langword="true" /> if the element has keyboard focus; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.HasKeyboardFocus" />.
<see langword="true" /> if the element has keyboard focus; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.

Triggers recalculation of the main properties of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" /> and raises the <see cref="E:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged" /> notification to the Automation Client if the properties changed.

Examples of main properties include, but are not limited to, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.LogicalChildren%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderFragment.BoundingRectangle%2A>.
trans-unit.target: Exemples de propriétés principales incluent, mais ne sont pas limités à, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.LogicalChildren%2A> et <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderFragment.BoundingRectangle%2A>.

trans-unit.source: Typically, updates and notifications happen automatically after the update of the layout in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)].
trans-unit.target: En règle générale, les mises à jour et les notifications s’exécutent automatiquement après la mise à jour de la disposition dans [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)].

trans-unit.source: (The update occurs in response to the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.LayoutUpdated> event.) Sometimes, however, properties change without raising the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.LayoutUpdated> event.
trans-unit.target: (La mise à jour se produit en réponse à la <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.LayoutUpdated> événements.) Dans certains cas, toutefois, modification des propriétés sans déclencher la <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.LayoutUpdated> événement.

trans-unit.source: For example, when the whole <xref:System.Windows.Window> moves, the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.LayoutUpdated> event is not raised.
trans-unit.target: Par exemple, lorsque l’ensemble <xref:System.Windows.Window> se déplace, le <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.LayoutUpdated> événement n’est pas déclenché.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the set of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderFragment.BoundingRectangle%2A> objects change because the objects are expressed in screen coordinates.
trans-unit.target: Dans cet exemple, le jeu de <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderFragment.BoundingRectangle%2A> objets modifié, car les objets sont exprimés en coordonnées d’écran.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, the <xref:System.Windows.Window> must call <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.InvalidatePeer%2A> on its peer on <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.WindowAutomationPeer>.
trans-unit.target: Par conséquent, le <xref:System.Windows.Window> doit appeler <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.InvalidatePeer%2A> son homologue sur <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.WindowAutomationPeer>.

trans-unit.source: Gets a value that indicates whether the element that is associated with this automation peer contains data that is presented to the user.
<see langword="true" /> if the element is a content element; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
A content element contains data that is presented to the user.
trans-unit.target: Un élément de contenu contient des données présentées à l’utilisateur.

trans-unit.source: An example of a content element is an item in a list box or a button in a dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Un exemple d’un élément de contenu est un élément dans une zone de liste ou un bouton dans une boîte de dialogue.

trans-unit.source: You typically use non-content elements (which are also referred to as peripheral elements) to work with the content in a composite control.
trans-unit.target: Vous utilisez généralement les éléments non-content (qui sont également appelés éléments périphériques) pour manipuler le contenu dans un contrôle composite.

trans-unit.source: An example of a non-content element is the button in a drop-down control.
trans-unit.target: Un exemple d’un élément sans contenu est le bouton dans un contrôle de liste déroulante.

trans-unit.source: When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsContentElement" />.
<see langword="true" /> if the element is a content element; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.

Gets a value that indicates whether the element is understood by the user as interactive or as contributing to the logical structure of the control in the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_gui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-gui-md.md)].
<see langword="true" /> if the element is a control; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsControlElement" />.
<see langword="true" /> if the element is a control; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
Gets a value that indicates whether the element associated with this automation peer supports interaction.
<see langword="true" /> if the element supports interaction; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsEnabled" />.
<see langword="true" /> if the automation peer can receive and send events; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.

Gets a value that indicates whether the element that is associated with this <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" /> hosts <see langword="hwnds" /> in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)].

<see langword="true" /> if the element that is associated with this <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" /> hosts <see langword="hwnds" /> in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)]; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
trans-unit.target: <see langword="true" /> Si l’élément qui est associé à ce <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" /> hôtes <see langword="hwnds" /> dans [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)]; sinon, <see langword="false" />.

trans-unit.source: Two examples of elements that host `hwnds` in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] are <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup>.
trans-unit.target: Deux exemples d’éléments qui hébergent `hwnds` dans [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] sont <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost> et <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup>.

trans-unit.source: These peers must also override <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetHostRawElementProviderCore%2A>.
trans-unit.target: Ces homologues doivent également substituer <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetHostRawElementProviderCore%2A>.

trans-unit.source: Gets a value that indicates whether the element can accept keyboard focus.
<see langword="true" /> if the element can accept keyboard focus; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsKeyboardFocusable" />.
<see langword="true" /> if the element can accept keyboard focus; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
Gets a value that indicates whether an element is off the screen.
<see langword="true" /> if the element is not on the screen; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
This property does not indicate whether the element is visible.
trans-unit.target: Cette propriété n’indique pas si l’élément est visible.

trans-unit.source: In some circumstances, an element is on the screen but is still not visible.
trans-unit.target: Dans certains cas, un élément est sur l’écran, mais est toujours pas visible.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the element is on the screen but obscured by other elements, it might not be visible.
trans-unit.target: Par exemple, si l’élément se trouve sur l’écran, mais il est masqué par d’autres éléments, il n’est pas forcément visible.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the method returns `false`.
trans-unit.target: Dans ce cas, la méthode retourne `false`.

trans-unit.source: When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsOffscreen" />.
<see langword="true" /> if the element is not on the screen; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
Gets a value that indicates whether the element contains sensitive content.
<see langword="true" /> if the element contains sensitive content such as a password; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsPassword" />.
<see langword="true" /> if the element contains sensitive content; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
Gets a value that indicates whether the element that is associated with this peer must be completed on a form.
<see langword="true" /> if the element must be completed; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsRequiredForForm" />.
<see langword="true" /> if the element is must be completed; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
One of the enumeration values.
Gets a value that indicates whether [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] is listening for the specified event.
A <see langword="boolean" /> that indicates whether [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] is listening for the event.
Typically, you call this method before creating the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> that raises the event.
trans-unit.target: En règle générale, vous appelez cette méthode avant de créer le <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> qui déclenche l’événement.

trans-unit.source: This method is a performance measure because if [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] does not listen for the event, it does not make sense to create a peer to raise one.
trans-unit.target: Cette méthode est une mesure de performances, car si [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] n’écoute pas pour l’événement, il est inutile de créer un homologue pour en déclencher un.

trans-unit.source: This method is static and only answers if a delegate listens for the specified event in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)], not for an event on a specific element.
trans-unit.target: Cette méthode est statique et répond uniquement si un délégué écoute l’événement spécifié dans [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)], pas un événement sur un élément spécifique.

trans-unit.source: [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] can create broadcast listeners; therefore the per-element information is irrelevant.
trans-unit.target: [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] peut créer des écouteurs de diffusion ; Par conséquent, les informations de l’élément ne sont pas pertinentes.

trans-unit.source: The class that implements <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple" />.
Gets an <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" /> for the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple" /> proxy.
An <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" /> for the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple" /> proxy.
The automation peer.
Gets the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple" /> for the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" />.
The proxy.
The event data.
Called by the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer" /> to raise the <see cref="F:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.AsyncContentLoadedEvent" /> event.
The event identifier.
Raises an automation event.
The property that changed.
The previous value of the property.
The new value of the property.
Raises an event to notify the automation client of a changed property value.
Synchronously resets the tree of child elements by calling <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetChildrenCore" />.
Use this method in certain peer implementations that change the set of child elements in response to a call to a control pattern interface.
trans-unit.target: Utilisez cette méthode dans certaines implémentations d’homologue qui modifient le jeu d’éléments enfants en réponse à un appel à une interface de modèle de contrôle.

trans-unit.source: An example is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITextProvider>, which can change the child elements of the peer by moving the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextRange>.
trans-unit.target: Par exemple <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITextProvider>, ce qui peut modifier les éléments enfants de l’homologue en déplaçant le <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextRange>.

trans-unit.source: Sets the keyboard focus on the element that is associated with this automation peer.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <see cref="M:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.SetFocus" />.
